{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3687624,"name":"","username":"Kevin_Leonard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kevin_leonard/{size}/237299_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T13:38:16.900Z","cooked":"

There were plenty of mechanisms the last few years where a CIM or BAG or MiniCIM would have done the trick, but we had to use a brushless motor for weight reasons.

Level the playing field, let us pay $20 for a motor again and not be at a massive disadvantage (at least when it comes to robot weight).

image313×144 4.81 KB

(Obviously the motors would have to be plugged in using a breaker slot, and the motor controller mass would still count.)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T13:38:16.900Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":93,"reads":1119,"readers_count":1118,"score":1098.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":27}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16805,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":26},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":41,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687628,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T13:41:49.097Z","cooked":"

So the tradeoff is PDH/PDB slots for free ballast when a max weight robot game comes up

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T13:41:57.782Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":1111,"readers_count":1110,"score":602.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":25}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Flyin' a hull |5934←2451←2767←876"},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":20},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":25,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687630,"name":"Ryan Dognaux","username":"Ryan_Dognaux","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_dognaux/{size}/129138_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T13:47:08.470Z","cooked":"

Pretty neat idea. If the weight limit stays at 115, maybe this could be a way to allow 125 lb robots with up to 10 lbs brushed motors in use. I could see some innovative ways teams could push the envelope while creating incentive to reuse the plethora of brushed motors many teams have.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T13:47:08.470Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":1081,"readers_count":1080,"score":301.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"Ryan Dognaux","primary_group_name":"Thriftybot","flair_name":"Thriftybot","flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":58,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":985,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"www.thethriftybot.com"},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687631,"name":"Yuval Gur | Electronics & Software mentor","username":"YuvalGur-2231","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/y/df788c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T13:50:20.876Z","cooked":"

Maybe motors should only count as 75% of their actual weight, because if they’re not counted at all, teams might start using them as dead weight just to exploit the rules.

We both know, this rule will be abused

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T13:50:20.876Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":1052,"readers_count":1051,"score":290.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"Yuval Gur | Electronics & Software mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53376,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687633,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T13:54:31.296Z","cooked":"

Honestly I love the design trade-offs and discussions this would create for teams. But how would you suggest this be enforced easily at inspection? Also, how would you ensure teams aren’t putting brushed motors on their robot for “free ballast”?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T13:54:31.296Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":988,"readers_count":987,"score":372.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687634,"name":"","username":"Kevin_Leonard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kevin_leonard/{size}/237299_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T13:54:35.718Z","cooked":"
YuvalGur-2231:

because if they’re not counted at all, teams might start using them as dead weight just to exploit the rules.

Only up to the # of available breaker slots. If a team managed to use 10 extra CIMs instead of 10 Kraken x44’s, that’s an additional ~25 lbs?

Could always cap the “free weight” at ~10 lb, so robots never end up over 125 lbs.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T13:54:35.718Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":935,"readers_count":934,"score":266.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16805,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687639,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T14:04:32.826Z","cooked":"

So, instead of “put your robot on the scale. Weigh it,” we’d be “Put your robot on the scale. Ok, which brushless motors do you have? Let me look in the chart for how much they weigh, ok, do some math…”?

And then you have people who use brushless motors for ballast – do they count or not?

It’s probably helpful to understand WHY there’s a weight limit. Part of it is just to put a constraint – to make teams to make choices – and that’s part of what engineering is. But, part of it is safety-related and part of it is because we don’t want 150-lb behemoths running around the field.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T14:04:32.826Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":859,"readers_count":858,"score":356.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"CEF","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/7","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":12}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687641,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T14:04:35.910Z","cooked":"
Ryan_Dognaux:

Pretty neat idea. If the weight limit stays at 115, maybe this could be a way to allow 125 lb robots with up to 10 lbs brushed motors in use. I could see some innovative ways teams could push the envelope while creating incentive to reuse the plethora of brushed motors many teams have.

I think the sticking point here is that the max robot weight limit is there (as far as I know) for lifting safety requirements. So you can’t really just ‘give away’ free weight.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T14:04:35.910Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":794,"readers_count":793,"score":368.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":13}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":13,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687646,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T14:05:14.051Z","cooked":"

Count the brushless motors of each type connected to a PDH slot, each type has a known weight, subtract that from the measured weight.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T14:05:14.051Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":740,"readers_count":739,"score":183.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19532,"username":"cad321","name":"Brian Wagg","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687650,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T14:06:11.640Z","cooked":"

That is almost certainly one of the reasons, but I think it’s a good rule regardless as design tradeoffs are a good thing to have in a game.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T14:06:11.640Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":723,"readers_count":722,"score":234.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":7841,"username":"Tom_Line","name":"Tom Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687651,"name":"","username":"Kevin_Leonard","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kevin_leonard/{size}/237299_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T14:06:26.957Z","cooked":"
CEF:

So, instead of “put your robot on the scale. Weigh it,” we’d be “Put your robot on the scale. Ok, which brushless motors do you have? Let me look in the chart for how much they weigh, ok, do some math…”?

Oh no! Not math in our STEM competition!

CEF:

And then you have people who use brushless motors for ballast – do they count or not?

Kevin_Leonard:

Could always cap the “free weight” at ~10 lb, so robots never end up over 125 lbs.

pigrammer:

Count the brushless motors of each type connected to a PDH slot, each type has a known weight, subtract that from the measured weight.

These are eminently solvable problems.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T14:06:26.957Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":3,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":714,"readers_count":713,"score":342.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":13}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16805,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/11","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":13}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":13,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687655,"name":"Ryan Dognaux","username":"Ryan_Dognaux","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_dognaux/{size}/129138_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T14:10:39.469Z","cooked":"

Fair point, we should probably avoid giving these kids back issues.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T14:10:39.469Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":651,"readers_count":650,"score":195.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"Ryan Dognaux","primary_group_name":"Thriftybot","flair_name":"Thriftybot","flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":58,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7841,"username":"Tom_Line","name":"Tom Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":985,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"www.thethriftybot.com"},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/12","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687662,"name":"Curt Rozeboom","username":"BlueEpiphone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/blueepiphone/{size}/197122_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T14:21:04.643Z","cooked":"

If we have a 10lb brushed motor allowance that is meant to benefit lower resource teams, it’s more likely to come as a result of a lowered initial limit and keep the safety margin.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T14:21:04.643Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":641,"readers_count":640,"score":133.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"Curt Rozeboom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":985,"username":"Ryan_Dognaux","name":"Ryan Dognaux","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_dognaux/{size}/129138_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32089,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5010 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/13","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687665,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T14:23:38.403Z","cooked":"

If you stuck with last year’s rule of 115 lbs, you could do the 10 lb. idea and make the lifting moot.

But what is the benefit here? The cost argument really isn’t convincing to me. The number of mechanisms on a robot that don’t need a location motor are usually pretty small. Intake rollers come to mind. But on our last robot that would be the only location where I would freely give away the built in encoder.

And are many people really struggling to stay under weight while using all the PDH locations, especially with CTRE’s PDH2?

Alternative solution: for every brushed motor a team uses the cost of one Kraken is refunded from their season registration cost. Call it the “recycle/reuse” initiative sponsored by some environmental group.

Edit: oops, wrong post replied to

Tom_Line:

But what is the benefit here? The cost argument really isn’t convincing to me. The number of mechanisms on a robot that don’t need a location motor are usually pretty small.

Maybe your team needs built-in internal encoders on everything, but many teams are running intakes, winches, serializers without using the built-in encoders, and for things like arms teams often use an external sensor anyway.

Reducing the cost of 10% of the robots in the program by potentially $300 by using two CIMs where a team would have otherwise used Krakens seems low cost, high reward.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T14:37:30.084Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":14,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":592,"readers_count":591,"score":228.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16805,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/17","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687685,"name":"Curt Rozeboom","username":"BlueEpiphone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/blueepiphone/{size}/197122_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T14:46:30.663Z","cooked":"

I’ll bite Interesting thought. I kinda figure the cost savings makes it easier to afford registrations anyway, if that wasn’t the goal in the first place? They have sent out these motors in the KOP, or they are on FIRST Choice, so really affordable. I’m not sure we could ask our finance strapped mothership to subsidize a design choice more than they already are. Recycling older motors could put you in line for a sustainability award, so there’s another benefit.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":92,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T14:46:30.663Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":572,"readers_count":571,"score":204.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504548,"topic_slug":"brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit","display_username":"Curt Rozeboom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":26091,"username":"kswaid","name":"Kyle Swaidner","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/df788c/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32089,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5010 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/brushed-motors-shouldnt-count-towards-the-weight-limit/504548/19","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687730,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T15:49:14.308Z","cooked":"

I suggest that the number of teams who would take advantage of this rule change doesn’t justify the complications caused by the change. And, you do still have the problem now that the robot is heavier, so harder to lift. (And there are already concerns about students not safely lifting their robots.)

It’s a fun idea but I’m still more a proponent of limiting the quantity of big expensive motors used just by count. What if the drivetrain motor limit rule only applied to brushless motors (go ahead, build a 12CIM swerve if you so desire)
